page.title: 05A day in a farmer's life 1
page.content: Mr Thomas Edgar is a local farmer. This is one of his days. A farmer's day usually starts at 5.30 am. He gets up and goes to collect the cows for milking. He does this by standing at the milking parlour and giving a long low whistle. The cows know what the whistle means and come down the hill. By the time Mr Edgar has switched on the milking machine and got the feed ready the cows are coming into the milking parlour. At 7 o'clock the milking is finished and Mr Edgar goes to feed the calves. It is then 7.30 am and Mr Edgar can go and get his own breakfast.
